meanings.sent1: The blore of the children playing outside could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The blore of the traffic in the city was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The blore of the animals in the zoo made the visitors giggle.
meanings.sent4: The blore of the market was like a symphony of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The blore of the thunderstorm shook the windows.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, confused noise.
meanings.sent1: The children love to blore when they are excited.
meanings.sent2: The engine started to blore loudly in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent3: The old radio would blore unexpectedly, scaring the cat.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks blored in the sky, painting it with light.
meanings.sent5: The crowd began to blore with excitement as the band took the stage.
